title: Mum and boyfriend beat son, 2, to death after he refused to eat hot dog
text:

A mum has been locked up for killing her son after he refused to eat a hot dog.

Elizabeth Woolheater hit two-year-old Anthony Bunn at their home in Kansas.

The toddler had enraged his mum by refusing to eat a hot dog, Woolheater said in court, before her boyfriend Lucas Diel threw in further blows.

The brutal partner then held the food in the boy's mouth.

Police were called to the home when Anthony stopped breathing on May 4 last year.

When they arrived the officers found he had injuries to his head and face.

He was rushed to Wesley Medical Centre in a critical condition.

Despite the best efforts of doctors there, Anthony died two days later.

A post-mortem examination of his body discovered that he had numerous broken bones and swelling to the brain.

He had also been malnourished at the time of his death.

After pleading guilty to second-degree murder and two counts of child abuse, Woolheater was sentenced to 19 years and five months in prison on Friday.

“I know that I’ll never be able to make up for or undo the mistakes I made,” Woolheater said in court, Kansas reported .

“I know that I failed my son when he needed me.

“I do want it to be known that I did love Tony — and I still do — with all my heart.”

Diel denied hitting the boy but was found guilty of second degree murder by a jury.

He will spend 49 years behind bars.

Before Anthony died the Department for Children and Families were told he was being abuse.

Zak Woolheater, his grandfather, said the family began suspecting something was not right in October 2017 when they noticed bruises and marks on his body.

Despite his concerned family members taking him to hospital and reporting their suspicions of child abuse, the district attorney was unable to find enough evidence to bring the case forward.

Zak described Anthony as "the most amazing kid you will ever see."
description: WARNING - UPSETTING CONTENT Elizabeth Woolheater killed her son Anthony Bunn after he refused to eat his breakfast at home in Kansas
